website_summaries.verdict: With tried and true hardware inside the bulb and smooth performance on multiple platforms, this $15 smart bulb is a smart bet for connected lighting.
pros: The Cree Connected LED boasts solid lighting specs, strong ease of use, a wide range of control options, and a terrific price point
cons: Unlike standard Cree LEDs, the new connected bulbs won't dim very well on dimmer switches due to interference from the built-in Zigbee dimming smarts
Also, the all-plastic aesthetic might not appeal to everyone

customer_reviews.title: worked very easily with the wink hub I have replaced 13 standard ...
customer_reviews.text: worked very easily with the wink hub I have replaced 13 standard bulbs in my home so far and plan to replace the remaining bulbs with these connected bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulb for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: A bit tricky to setup on WeMo Bridge (as you need to turn on bulb, then quickly pair), but cheaper then other WeMo compatible bulbs, and works great once setup.
customer_reviews.author: DorCino

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm white
customer_reviews.text: Nice warm white, dims up when it turns on, and dims down when it turns off. I like the style of the bulb also - unique.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bulbs and bright. Set up on wink system and synced quickly.
customer_reviews.author: McMazing

customer_reviews.title: Great light quality, reliable once associated
customer_reviews.text: Great light quality, reliable once associated. Getting them initially associated (with a SmartThings hub in my case) is a bit tricky - it involves switching the power on and off a few times in a pattern, and took me a couple tries to get two bulbs in a ceiling fixture to associate at the same time. Zigbee devices with a button are easier. Anyway, I'm quite happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome technology to be able to control the brightness of ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome technology to be able to control the brightness of the bulb, love the dimmable features of it, but had to go out and buy a wink hub from home depot which i didnt realize when i first ordered it. I have about 8 wemo devices in my house and heard cree bulbs work with wemo now but i dont seem to see any cross compatible yet, might be coming soon?
customer_reviews.author: Behrman House

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it should be a great product but we have ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it should be a great product but we have had to remove it from our system because it has a loud buzz or hum that gets louder as the bulb is turned up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mageean

customer_reviews.title: A nice bulb however
customer_reviews.text: A nice bulb however, it would have been nice if it was Amazon Echo friendly but it isn't, and I use my phone if I desire to control it while I'm not at home. So I give it 4-stars because it's a great bulb indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Jgrier011

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with SmartThings controller, and the light has a warm color. The only problem in some cases is that the output is not very bright. So it will best be deployed in locations that don't require much lighting, and where you are looking for a more yellowish tint as opposed to a pure white light.
customer_reviews.author: John Pozadzides

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality! Dimming is amazing. Works great with SmartThings. Its absolutely worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashutosh J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am using this light bulb in conjunction with a smartthings hub. Easy to install, wrote smart codes for and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Does not dim well and it makes a ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Does not dim well and it makes a fairly loud humming sound.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Crap. Not work with SmartThings at all
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Not work with SmartThings at all. 1) Pairing - just good luck do get it after an hour 2) SmartThing hub can only show you it switched on or off for some time in some cases. want to get it back, but will try to bring it to life
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connection unreliable?? Quick replacement...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these to increase my smart home library. Great price, and connected easily to my SmartThings hub. But, within two weeks, both bulbs had once suddenly disconnected (separately), they reconnected, and then they both disconnected at the same time. I called Cree customer service after doing troubleshooting on my own without reconnection. They are sending replacements. I like the bulb for it's ease of use (when working), but I hope this isn't a consistent issue! Will update my review after replacements arrive, and/or after a different result.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin I.

customer_reviews.title: get them from your local homedepo where they are 1/2 the cost and you can easily return them if they refuse to pair
customer_reviews.text: Way over priced on Amazon. These bulbs are $14.95 at hope depo. I have 8 of these bulbs and agree with other comments that they are relatively cheaply made. Of the original 8, 3 would not connect no matter what(resets, multiple zigbee hub types etc). Around the same time I purchases 4 of the GE Zigbee Link bulbs, these seem to work consistently(stay connected to Zigbee), and have a much higher quality build feel to them, and are also @ $14.95 on Amazon. In short, if you are going to get the Cree version, get them from your local homedepo where they are 1/2 the cost and you can easily return them if they refuse to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Webb

customer_reviews.title: No voice control with Alexa (Echo) and Hue Bridge
customer_reviews.text: Bought these thinking I could voice command them on/off with Amazon Echo (Alexa) using existing Philips Hue Bridge. This does not work. The bulb is fine, and the Hue app can control these bulbs through a smartphone. However, if you already own an Hue Bridge, and wish to be able to use that bridge to have Alexa control these bulbs (rather than shell out $100+ for an additional wink or smart things hub), it will not work as of this writing. I've seen others hoping since August this would work...it still does not. The workaround of buying another bridge is balldiculous
customer_reviews.author: C Winger

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a simple led light bulb, but cannot be found/paired by Echo Plus. The packaging clearly states "Only Amazon Echo Plus allows for direct connection" and I have been able to pair my Echo Plus with a Zigbee Phillips Hue bulb but I have bought 2 of these Cree bulbs and neither one of them are discoverable in the Alexa app.
customer_reviews.author: jrazza

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulb, The color looks and feels like an incandescent bulb
customer_reviews.text: As of (July-1-2015) Does NOT currently work with Amazon Echo, using the Hue Hub. It will automatically connect to your Hue Hub, and you can control it with the Hue App, but the Amazon Echo can't find it for some reason. Support may/could be added later. If you're looking for an alternative smart bulb this is a good one. I was pleased with the brightness, and functionally of the bulb, and it's equivalent to the GE-Link bulbs. I kind of like this bulb more because it doesn't get as hot as the GE-Link bulbs. I just wish it worked with Echo.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mackin

customer_reviews.title: love these bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: I have mine connected primarily to Smartthings and one to the Hue. They look like real bulbs and unlike the Hue Bulb, they do not heat up so I have been using one in a closed fixture with no issues. They are also brighter than the Hue which makes them better for reading. Note that they are $15 at Home Depot. A big difference if you buy enough for your house. You can only buy them I store though.
customer_reviews.author: tharp83

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb
customer_reviews.text: I got a 60w Cree Connected at my local hardware store. Pros + Supports dimming + Supports Zigbee Cons - Dimming requires a compatible dimmer or the dimmer app - Zigbee equipment can be expensive Neutral - The shell is plastic One last note is to compare prices as the suggested retail price is much less than what is listed here. In addition to that there are some deals online where spending a hundred bucks in peripherals gets a free hub.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bulb
customer_reviews.text: I really like these bulbs as a cheaper alternative to the Lux bulbs. Well, cheaper when purchased locally, not at this Amazon price. They dim almost as well as a Lux and have really nice quality light. The conventional shape helps in certain applications as well. These are my go-to bulb now when I don't need a Lux. One thing, I wouldn't attempt to use this one outside. I'm sure it would fill up with bugs in no time. At least where I live.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent connected bulb when I purchased them for $15 each ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent connected bulb when I purchased them for $15 each at the end of 2016. Works well with my Smartthings Hub (v2). At $35+ each it's time to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper at local Home Depot
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and easy to connect to with Smartthings and Echo. Wouldn't pay these prices. Go to Home Depot and buy for $15
customer_reviews.author: H Winter

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a repeater
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a SmartThings repeater in my garage. Connected on the first try, and nicely extends the range of my hub. It's the bulb in my garage door opening unit, which is perfect since I never turn that off using a wall switch anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb but loud noise in dimming lamps.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in regular lamps. I use it with Wink and it's very reliable. However, beware that it makes a loud noise when used in a dimming lamp. It dims without noise in regular lamps, but makes the noise in dimming lamps regardless of whether it is dimmed or set to full power. If not for the noise, I would give it 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Big light small price
customer_reviews.text: These are great work flawless inside and out with the Hue Bridge, still no support for the Amazon Echo, I sue hope that changes.
customer_reviews.author: blk182atn7

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb! It's bright
customer_reviews.text: Great bulb! It's bright, easy to connect and control. I'm using WINK. My only complaint is the activation time, ~1.5 seconds from button press. I would assume that this is because of where we are in this "new" form of technology HOLY COW, they are $15 @ home depot compared to the $30 Prime from Cree
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Resetting the bulb is painful. But just tonight I was able to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Resetting the bulb is painful. But just tonight I was able to have Alexa control them!!! Yes finally there is the light at the end of the tunnel. Pun intended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C Girard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with my Vera Plus gateway
customer_reviews.text: This bulb doesn't work with the Vera gateways. For some reason it won't pair with the hub, giving a 'can't configure' error. The Vera Plus hub, which I have, is supposed to support generic zigbee devices, but I couldn't get it to work. For that reason, I don't like it. However, it is not the bulb's fault. It seems like a sturdy, well made product, and I'm sure it will perform well with a compatible hub.
customer_reviews.author: BobWJ

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to bulbs. Simple to set up and use with the Wink hub and then controlled through my Echo...but these bulbs are 1/2 the price elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Good features, Buzzes at brightnesses over 50%
customer_reviews.text: So, it works fine, connectivity with WEMO link and app is seamless. BUT it buzzes pretty noticeably at any brightness over about 50%. So in a quiet room, with this in say, a lamp, or above the sink, it's annoyingly audible. But the price is hard to beat for a connected LED
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of faulty wireless
customer_reviews.text: I was initially excited to get these because hey work with Hue and are cheaper. I bought three several months ago, got two setup, but the third is still suborn and won't connect. I fear that the wireless controller is broken. Other than the one faulty one, the other two work well, but when I pulled them out of the packaging they seemed very cheap (you get what you pay for, I guess). The build quality of the Philips bulbs is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgeteer

product_meta.title: Cree Connected 60W Soft White (2700K) Dimmable LED Light Bulb (Single Pack)
feature_bullets: Works with Amazon Alexa to support dimming through voice control.
Can be controlled from anywhere with your Android or iOS device
Uses 81% less energy when compared with an incandescent light bulb
Estimated yearly energy cost: $1.64 (based on 3 hrs/day, 11/kWh. costs depend on rates and use)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars43 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
